channel.title: Building a Gaming Rig
channel.description:
I will need to upgrade for games like APB and BF:BC2. I am getting about 20 frames in APB right now.
I will be running 64-bit Windows 7 (NOT CHANGEABLE) Video Card: NVidia GTX: 260 PCI-E (NOT CHANGEABLE) Power Supply: Rocketfish 700w Power Supply http://www.rocketfishproducts.com/p-...er-supply.aspx (CHANGEABLE, BUT PREFERRED IF KEPT SAME) Motherboard: http://www.newegg.com/Product/Produc...82E16813128394 (IDEA) Processor: AMD Phenom II (You guys decide 4/6 cores) Ram: ? Case: ? HDD: Other shit i dunno about:?
Budget I am unsure of, $300-800
The latest I will be getting these parts is December, depending on pricing

item.title: Building a Gaming Rig
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

vx450w + 1055t + GB-MA790X + 5770 + 500gb WD + 4gb ddr3 gskill ripjaws

you do the neweggin, case whatever you like.

Read full topic

item.title: Building a Gaming Rig
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

I’m not really a fan of the AMD Phenom II, You should try and stay with homebrew CPUs! You should go for a 7400 CPU or CMOS if you want speed. You’ll need a few megabytes of ram if you actually want to do something but 1meg should be fine, 640k is all anyone will need!

Read full topic
